definition: to pass an exam or a test/to meet a minimum standard
square/frame/rule/(legal) case/style/character/standard/pattern/(grammar) case/(classical) to obstruct/to hinder/(classical) to arrive/to come/(classical) to investigate/to study exhaustively
passing line or score (in an examination)

pinyin: Sheng4 Wen2 sen1 ji2 Ge2 rui4 na4 ding1

sentences.english: He failed in the end-of-term exam.
The mother licked the child for failing the examination.
sentences.chinese: 母亲因孩子考试不及格而打了他。

sentences.english: Whether you can pass your exams, all boils down to how much studying you are able to do.
sentences.chinese: 你考试能否及格全看你学习有多努力。

sentences.english: He passed the examination, contrary to what I expected.
sentences.chinese: 他考试及格了，这出乎我的预料。

sentences.english: In school teach him it is far more honourable to fail than to cheat.
sentences.chinese: 教他求学时不及格比作弊来得刚正。

sentences.english: I become phenomenon, moral fail, always have good ideas.
sentences.chinese: 我成为现象，思想品德不及格，总比没思想好。

sentences.english: If you take(follow) my advice, you'll pass the exam.
sentences.chinese: 如果你听我的劝告，你会考及格。

sentences.english: They heard this morning that they had passed the examination, so they went out to paint the town red.
sentences.chinese: 今天上午他们得知考试及格，于是都出去狂欢一场。

sentences.english: I'm worried that I will fail in the examination.
sentences.chinese: 这个女孩考试不及格使家长深感忧虑。

sentences.english: A third of the students failed in thee xam.
sentences.chinese: 有三分之一的学生在这次考试中没及格。

sentences.english: I flunked math in second grade.
sentences.chinese: 我二年级时数学不及格。

sentences.english: Wendy did very well in her math exam.
sentences.chinese: 温迪一年级的数学考试不及格。

sentences.english: Otherwise they might fail the test, and it would be a disaster.
sentences.chinese: 否则它们可能会考试不及格，而这将是一个灾难。

sentences.english: Bill doesn't give a hoot whether he passes his examination or not.
sentences.chinese: 比尔对考试及格还是不及格一点都不在乎。

sentences.english: Bill doesn't give a hoot whether he passes his examination or not.
sentences.chinese: 比尔对考试及格还是不及格一点都不在乎。

definition: passing line or score (in an examination)
to beat/to hit/variant of 考[kao3]/to inspect/to test/to take an exam
to check/to verify/to test/to examine/to take an exam/to take an entrance exam for/deceased father
to sit for a makeup exam/to resit an exam/makeup exam/resit
